measurements.id: Purified Water , Flow meter No. Fm-1010

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the reactor.
Charge Purified Water (Lot-I) into the reactor.
Charge GP HCI into the reactor under stirring.
Charge CS Lye (Lot-I) from the receiver SSRC-1010 to the reactor below 30°C.
Charge Activated carbon slurry (Purified Water Lot-II + Activated carbon) into the reactor.
Stir for 20 to 30 minutes.
Check the cleanliness of the reactor.Filter reaction mass through the filter setup (SSCF-1001,SSMF-1001&SSMF-1002). Initially re-circulate the mass for 10 to 15 minutes.
If found satisfactory, transfer the filtered mass to another clean reactor (GLRE 1014).
After completion of filtration flush the filter setup with Nitrogen pressure.
Charge Purified Water Lot-III into reactor.
Transfer the Water through the filter setup into GLRE 1014.
Slowly adjust the mass pH to 7.0 to 7.5 with filtered CS Lye (Lot-II) from receiver SSRC-1004 below 40°C.
Maintain for 30 minutes at 30°C to 40°C.
Cool to below 5°C.
Check the cleanliness of the Centrifuge.
Load the Lot-I material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-II material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-III material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-IV material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-V material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-VI material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-VII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-VIII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3
Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Check the cleanliness of the reactor.
Charge IPA (Lot-I) from receiver SSRC-1011 to reactor.
Charge Methanol from receiver SSRC-1012 to reactor.
Charge Purified Water (Lot-V) and stir for 15 to 30 minutes.
Charge the GP Tech material into the reactor through PCS under stirring.
Stir for 15 to 30 min.
Raise the temperature to 40°C to 45°C.
Maintain the temperature for 30 to 45 minutes an hour at 40°C to 45°C.
Cool the reaction mass 0°C to 5°C.
Maintain for 30 to 45 minutes at 0°C to 5°C.
Check the cleanliness of the ANFD. Transfer the reaction mass from the reactor (GLRE-1015) to ANFD.
Filter the mass by applying Nitrogen pressure to ANFD until removing the MLR to the collection tank SSST-1005.
Wash the material with IPA (Lot-II) from the receiver SSRC-1011 to ANFD.
Stir for 15 to 30 mins.
Apply Nitrogen pressure for 3 to 5 hours. The ML's are collected into a collection tank SSST-1005
Release Nitrogen pressure and apply Vacuum
Dry the material for 5 to 7 hours under vacuum.
Break the vacuum after completion of drying with nitrogen.
Cool the material to below 30°C.
